intro: Packera actinella, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette, and its flowers are small and clustered in a composite head. Packera actinella is often found in meadows and along stream banks at high elevations.
